alert.note: Alert for Barry; Christian; Stone (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 13 at 11:54AM CDT until April 13 at 1:30PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR EAST CENTRAL BARRY, CENTRAL CHRISTIAN AND CENTRAL STONE COUNTIES... At 1154 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Nixa, Ozark, Highlandville, Crane, Reeds Spring, Galena, Shell Knob and Mccord Bend. This includes the following low water crossings... Woods Fork at Woods Fork Road, Tin Can Hollow at Highway CC, Silver Lake Branch at Highway U, Bull Creek at Center Road and Tory Creek at Highway O. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
